name: ListAppUsers
description:
Retrieve all users assigned to a specific app.

Use this tool to list all users who have been assigned to a particular application in Okta. Useful for managing app users and access control.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the application whose assigned users you want to list.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of results. Use this as an opaque value from the next link.

value_schema.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the next link relationship. See [Pagination](/#pagination).

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of user records to return per page. Use this to control pagination effectively. Refer to the pagination guidelines for handling multiple pages.

value_schema.description:
Specifies the number of objects to return per page.
If there are multiple pages of results, the Link header contains a `next` link that you need to use as an opaque value (follow it, don't parse it).
See [Pagination](/#pagination).

parameters.name: filter_user_profile
parameters.description: Filter users based on profile attributes like `userName`, `firstName`, `lastName`, or `email`. Supports `startsWith` filtering.

value_schema.description:
Specifies a filter for the list of application users returned based on their profile attributes.
The value of `q` is matched against the beginning of the following profile attributes: `userName`, `firstName`, `lastName`, and `email`.
This filter only supports the `startsWith` operation that matches the `q` string against the beginning of the attribute values.
> **Note:** For OIDC apps, user profiles don't contain the `firstName` or `lastName` attributes. Therefore, the query only matches against the `userName` or `email` attributes.

parameters.name: include_user_object
parameters.description: Include this parameter to return the corresponding User object in the embedded property. Use 'user' as the value.

value_schema.description:
An optional query parameter to return the corresponding [User](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/User/) object in the `_embedded` property.
Valid value: `user`

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the okta API.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the next link relationship. See [Pagination](/#pagination).

value_schema.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of results. Treat this as an opaque value obtained through the next link relationship. See [Pagination](/#pagination).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Specifies the number of objects to return per page.
If there are multiple pages of results, the Link header contains a `next` link that you need to use as an opaque value (follow it, don't parse it).
See [Pagination](/#pagination).

value_schema.description:
Specifies the number of objects to return per page.
If there are multiple pages of results, the Link header contains a `next` link that you need to use as an opaque value (follow it, don't parse it).
See [Pagination](/#pagination).

parameters.description:
Specifies a filter for the list of application users returned based on their profile attributes.
The value of `q` is matched against the beginning of the following profile attributes: `userName`, `firstName`, `lastName`, and `email`.
This filter only supports the `startsWith` operation that matches the `q` string against the beginning of the attribute values.
> **Note:** For OIDC apps, user profiles don't contain the `firstName` or `lastName` attributes. Therefore, the query only matches against the `userName` or `email` attributes.

value_schema.description:
Specifies a filter for the list of application users returned based on their profile attributes.
The value of `q` is matched against the beginning of the following profile attributes: `userName`, `firstName`, `lastName`, and `email`.
This filter only supports the `startsWith` operation that matches the `q` string against the beginning of the attribute values.
> **Note:** For OIDC apps, user profiles don't contain the `firstName` or `lastName` attributes. Therefore, the query only matches against the `userName` or `email` attributes.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
An optional query parameter to return the corresponding [User](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/User/) object in the `_embedded` property.
Valid value: `user`

value_schema.description:
An optional query parameter to return the corresponding [User](/openapi/okta-management/management/tag/User/) object in the `_embedded` property.
Valid value: `user`

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
